course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Psychology of Personal Growth
course.description: This course introduces major challenges of adjustment individuals face during their transition to adulthood from a psychological perspective. Topics include self-concept, emotion, coping, romantic love, interpersonal relationships, and workplace issues.

reviews.author: tingtingo_O
reviews.title: Highly competitive course
reviews.comment_content:
Topics are interesting and related to daily life, which includes:
- Research Methods
- Everyday Coping
- Interpersonal Attraction and Love
- Health Behaviours
- Understanding Yourself
- Gender
- Sexual Behavior
- Psychology of Work
- Interpersonal Communication
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Lai explained everything clearly and is willing to repeat the page again when someone says he can't follow or can't understand that concept. She is also responsive in answering questions during lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 30%
After-Class Exercises 20%
Group Paper 40%
Research Experience 10%

Unlike previous semesters, this semester quiz has changed to an open book quiz, with essay type questions and NO MC QUESTION, which may somehow increase the workload.

My statistics:
Quiz: 27/30
After-Class Exercises (Full)
Research Experience (Full)
Group paper: (Me: 31/35, mean: 29.71, sd: 3.03)

With an overall score of around 92%, I still managed to get an A- in this course, which indicates this course is somehow competitive and it may be hard to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is acceptable. Wish yourself good luck to prevent a freeride groupmate as the groupmate is randomly assigned to you. Also, the paper has to be submitted after 1 month of the commencement of the semester, which will be close to the mid-term period.

Didn't read all the textbook required reading and it turns out that the quiz only tests on the materials covered in the lecture materials.

After class exercises and research experience are easy to complete as they are simply some surveys or only require you to write 100 words.

reviews.author: Revelio
reviews.title: Quite good grade and chill course
reviews.comment_content:
The content is interesting and quite useful for me. This course focuses on stress and relationship with others. After attending to this course, you can have better concept of the formation of stress, how to cope with it and the consequences of chronic stress. The sex and gender parts also impress me well. They mention about issues like gender gap, how males and females attract each other, and gender identity. There are poll, video and research given in the lecture. Polls are just for students to express their views, there is no model answer and is interesting to know how others think of the same topics with you. The polls are sometimes open-ended questions or mc questions.
Syllabus:
Research method
Understanding yourself
Everyday stress and coping
Health behaviors
Sex, gender, and sexual behavior
Interpersonal attraction and love
The challenges of the workplace
Interpersonal communication
reviews.comment_teaching: Although this sem is held online via zoom due to Covid-19, prof Wijaya did a good job in teaching this course. She explains concepts well and responds to the questions posted in chat room immediately. There's 10 mins break after 1hr20mins. The TAs are nice too, there are video and essay workshops, Vivien gives advices and responds to many questions from students.
reviews.comment_grading:
This sem is in online mode, so the grading scheme is little bit different from before.
1. Research study (5%)
2. Research exercise (5%)
3. After-class exercise 1 :Understanding yourself (20%)
4. Essay assignment (40%)
5. Video assignment (15%)
6. After-class exercise 2: The challenges of the workplace (15%)

My score (follow the order of hw above):
1. 5/5  mean:5
2. 5/5 mean:5
3. 18/20 mean: 16.3
4. 33/40 mean: 33.7
5. 15/15 mean: 11.2
6. 15/15 mean: 12.9
Overall: 91/100
I get A- finally. I think it is acceptable. The research study and exercise are quite easy, and is p/f manner.
reviews.comment_workload:
No attendance is needed.
There are some suggested reading material given after each lecture, but tbh i didn't read any one. The textbook is little bit useful but if you don't have,  also ok, lecture notes are already enough for understanding.
The two research assignments are asking students to finish questionnaires, then write around 100 words to answer the questions such as do you think the question match the purpose of the questionnaire? These two works are in p/f manner, if you pass, you can get full marks, if you fail, you still get one more chance to redo it.
The two after-class assignments are released after finish teaching certain chapters. You need to express your views, which is based on research. The second after class work need students to do a test, like personality test, then post the result in the hw. Finally, discuss about the test.
Essay is about a way to reduce stress, you need to describe, explain the solution and use scientific research to prove it. Then, you need to think of a barrier we may face when we adapt this strategy and suggestion to overcome the barrier. Lastly, you need to set up a plan or sth to explain how you adapt this way in your daily life. You need to write around 800 words.
Video assignment is asking you to choose a job and a city/country, describe the gender gap of this job in this place. You also need to show what difficulties you may face when you work in this industry, with some data proof. The most important part is to describe several solutions that you can prepare now to overcome the difficulties in the future. The max time limit is 5 mins 30 seconds, you don't need to make ppt, you can present a written paper to camera, you can edit the video, as long as prof can see your whole face clearly.

I think the workload is quite acceptable because this is a summer sem, I have much more spare time. However, i think it will be little bit heavy if you enroll it in regular sem.

reviews.author: LoveUST=False
reviews.title: Ok la
reviews.comment_content:
Topics are quite fun which include the followings:
- Emotion
- Everyday Coping
- Personality
- The Self
- Romantic Love
- Gender & Behavior
- Psychology of Work
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was fun. Michelle Yik tried to make the lecture more interesting by adding some experiment videos, doing some in-class experiments and sharing some extra knowledge.
reviews.comment_grading:
Research Exercise 10%
Individual Assignments 20%
Group Project 30%
Test 40%

There were two quizzes in total, both are open-book and open-notes. If you studied carefully, you should be able to handle it. The questions were mainly from lectures notes, the result of the in-class experiments and the textbook.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is acceptable for a winter semester course if you only aim to score around mean. Otherwise, you may need to pay more effort in reading the required reading.

The individual assignments were not an difficult job. You only need to write about 300 words each.

The project were about the emotion you felt during the pandemic. You need to explain how it arises and provide some strategies to cope with the emotion. Its about 700 words for each person.

reviews.author: Halis
reviews.title: Highly recommended SSC-SA course to take
reviews.comment_content: Two 3-hour classes in one week. Contents are the same as those in Fall / Spring, can refer to other's comments.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching style is good! Clear pronunciation and spends time explaining complicated concepts, which makes it easy to follow. There are very clear guidelines for each assignment, just follow them and you can get at least mean. The pace was a bit slow though, playing the lecture video on 2x is recommended.
reviews.comment_grading:
The file is attached below.

- Research Exercise + Study (5% + 5%)
- Essay (30%)
- After-Class Exercise (20%)
- Quiz (20%, 20MCs, 1 mark each, open-book & open-notes)
- Video Assignment (20%)

No attendance is needed for the course, so you can comfortably take this course while having a summer intern (It's more efficient to just play the lecture videos at 2x speed tbh)

My scores:
- 10/10 (you can get full marks as long as you completed it)
- 25/30 (mean: 23.75, sd: 4.16)
- 14/20 (mean: 15.26, sd: 3.63)
- 14/20 (mean: 10.26, sd: 3.28)
- 20/20 (mean: 15.53, sd: 4.25)

Overall grade: A-

Reasonable grade, not particularly good or bad.
reviews.comment_workload:
Each assignment takes around 3-4 hours to complete. Most time is spent researching for the right materials to justify intuitive explanations. There's a grace period for each submission. I can complete the assignments at a comfortable pace in the weekend while taking a full-time summer intern.

The quiz is also not hard and very straightforward. As long as you spend little time scanning through the lecture notes briefly, you can answer most questions with ease.

reviews.author: Zoe Choi
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite interesting and easy to understand. Some interesting videos, such as some social experiments, will also be played during the lecture. I think it helps me understand the lecture content more and memorize the concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof explains very clearly and she is willing to answer our questions. She is so nice and patient. If she doesn't have enough time to answer our questions in class, she will always address our questions in canvas after class.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is not harsh. For the quizzes, you can get high marks if you work hard.
reviews.comment_workload: 3 after-class exercises, 1 group paper, 2 quizzes

reviews.comment_teaching: Nice English and easy to understand. She answers your question with patience.
reviews.comment_grading: I don't know how to get A range for this course, my assignment, midterm and final are all above mean about one sd, but still I got a B+, maybe you have to get above mean 2 sd to secure an A. Good luck.

reviews.author: Ernest
reviews.title: Clearly Structured Course with Interesting Content
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting content with a considerable portion of the course related to daily life. Quite comprehensive coverage per section. Theory-based with quite some real-life examples to support. Sometimes there are interesting videos which show some experiments in relations to the class materials.

However the exams cover some content out of slides but in the textbook so reading materials do matter
reviews.comment_teaching: With good English and effort in organising the teaching materials, it is very easy to follow through and revisit the materials. Very kind in answering questions from students. Will usually stay behind lessons to answer students' questions.
reviews.comment_grading: You probably need to get a very good score in order to get A/A+. My two assignments were above mean for about 1 SD with both exams above mean, I got an A- at the end.
reviews.comment_workload:
Apart from mid-term and Final, only two write-ups which took just a few hours each for me. We also had TAs to assist the write-up, their guidance could save you some time in completing the assignments.

Mid-term and Final were both in MC, so you will not need to memorise a lot of stuff. Basic understanding would be enough to survive the course.

reviews.author: nonameeeeeee
reviews.comment_content:
An introduction course to psychology, not very difficult concepts are being taught.

One thing to note is that it is necessary to read the textbook and all the lecture ppts since the content in these two sources are quite different. In exams, both of them will be accessed.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In general, I think Michelle is a nice teacher but I personally do not appreciate her way of teaching. To be honest, I don't quite get a lot of knowledge just by taking her lectures. I feel kinda clueless after taking her lectures or maybe it's just because the duration of the lecture is quite long and kinda chur ğŸ˜‚ since there are 2 classes a day, 3 days a week.

Also, there's one thing I found quite weird and yet amusing is that she will also test on the results in the zoom poll. I didn't expect such content will be tested and so I didn't study it for the first test. I got a pretty bad score because of it. So make sure to study the zoom poll as well if you're taking zoom classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Research Exercise 10%
Individual Assignments 20%
Group Project 30%
Open-book Tests 40%
- Test 1 (15%) consists of True/False questions.
- Test 2 (25%) consists of True/False questions and long answers.

Overall, I think the grading is pretty nice and fair. I got below mean in the first test but above mean in the second test. Did not get full marks in assignments and group projects which I think many of the students in my class did. In the end, I still get an A-.
reviews.comment_workload: I would say the workload is pretty heavy since it's a 3 months course shortened to a 1-month course. There is an assignment to do every week. Plus we have to do read every required reading in the textbook which are all pretty long texts consisting of at least 20 pages for the tests. Group project also takes much time to handle and also please note that good teammates are really important because the individual parts in the project are all interrelated. Therefore, I think it's better to take it in regular semesters

reviews.author: é«˜æµ·åƒæ­Œ
reviews.title: Good course, aside from the textbook which causes me headache
reviews.comment_content:
8 topics (discussed in lecture):
1. Introduction
2. Emotion
3. Everyday Coping
4. Personality
5. The Self
6. Romantic Love
7. Gender & Behavior
8. Psychology of Work

To be honest, the content are quite interesting and I like them.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Michelle teaching is good. She constructs an interactive environment in the class. Sometimes she asks us for opinions or makes polling (Don't ignore them as she will literally ask you the poll result in the test). The collected data will be used to explain the concept which is going to be introduced. Also, she is willing to answer questions and even do a wrap-up session for all collected questions.

Nevertheless, the teaching pace of lecture is quite slow, since in the lecture only part of the concept will be introduced. From Michelle words "the purpose of lecture is arousing your interest to read the textbook". However, I still hope that she can teach more in the lecture rather than asking us to read textbook.

Lastly, no recording. Therefore, try not to escape class as you will definitely miss something. On the contrary, since the teaching pace is slow, if you attend and pay attention to the lecture you will very likely to follow the progress and don't need review
reviews.comment_grading:
As a CC, the grading is not bad, but not very good though since the competition is still a little bit high.

Grading Scheme:
Research exercise (10%)
Assignment (10%+10%)
Test  (15%+25%)
Group essay (5%+25%)

My result:
Research exercise (10%) : 10/10
Assignment 1 (10%) : 9/10
Assignment 2 (10%) : 10/10
Test 1 (15%) : 56/80
Test 2 (25%) :  45/60
Group essay outline (5%) : 5/5
Group final essay (25%) : 23/25

Total : 86.25%   Grade : A-

(I think the mean and sd have been clearly introduced by another post so I don't repeat here)

Referencing to other post and Goop, it looks like 85%-90% is A-. You still need to achieve high enough for A range. As the grading of research exercise, assignment and essay outline is lenient, the place where decide your fate is the two tests and final essay. For tests, make more revision. For essay, pray for not encountering freeriders =)

My test results is like around 0.4-0.6sd only but still managed to get A range. It looks like I am carried by my groupmates XD
reviews.comment_workload:
Since this is winter sem, the timetable is very tight. We have 6 lectures a week and the deadline comes fast. However, it should be less stressful in fall or spring sem

Here are the major tasks

1. Research exercises
Watching a video and write a short paragraph for summarizing the content and share your opinion. This part is pass/fail scheme so if you pass you automatically get 10%. Basically it is testing your sincerity so please don't fail it.

2. Required reading
Most troublesome part (in my opinion). You need to read a few chapters (around 8) in the textbook. The major purpose is for preparing the tests as Michelle will examine a lot about the textbook. If you don't read them, your tests will very likely to be screwed up.

However, I don't like reading and the textbook is crammed with words. As a result, the textbook offers me a realistic experience that I am experiencing headache when the textbook is introducing the concept of headache. What a good service. If you don't like reading, this part will be quite tough.

Moreover, you need to buy (or borrow) the textbook by yourself. The latest version is 14 and Michelle will follow the latest version. Being a poor person I just search the Internet and only found version 13 freely. I found there are some differences in the two versions (ver.13 has 14 chapters only but ver.14 has 15 chapters). However, I read version 13 only and still fine =) .

3. Assignments
Write two short essays (300 words each). Not very hard, but remember you need to show and apply the concept learnt in lecture but not simply talking superficial things otherwise you cannot get high marks.

4. Tests
Open-book, open-notes, open-internet. "Ctrl+F" and Google are your best friend.

Majority is True/False question. Therefore, good news is that you can have an expectation of 50% correct for blind guessing. However, if you want to achieve higher, you must read through all lecture slides and textbook as Michelle literally examines everything. She even asks you the result of polling conducted in class.  

There will be also one short essay question is Test 2. 400 words. The format is similar to assignment.

5. Group essay
First of all, universal rule for group work : Pray for no freeriders

As the group assignment is done by prof, you can only pray for that. If this catastrophe happens unfortunately, you can only either accept your fate or put double or even triple effort to carry your teammates.

The topic for this sem is negative emotions under covid-19 and you need to write 1600-2000 words for talking the negative emotions with coping strategies.

There are two stages for the essay : Outline and finalized essay

The outline is quite simple. It is only helping you brainstorming. The essay itself is not very difficult as well. If your group cooperate properly you can finish it in a few days.

To be honest, the required readings are more troublesome than the group project in my opinion = =

reviews.author: asdfghjkl123
reviews.title: Normal course
reviews.comment_content:
Topics:
- Introduction
- Emotion
- Everyday Coping
- Personality
- The Self
- Romantic Love
- Gender & Behavior
- Psychology of Work

Lecture notes + Textbook
Most of the contents in lecture notes are different from those in textbook.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Michelle is good and fun. Her lessons were all very interactive. You will seldom feel bored when having her lessons. She played music (usually Western music) during break. She always conducted some in-class experiments and she would use those results in the next lecture. She is very nice that she would answer nearly all questions asked by students.

No attendance was needed, however, no recordings would be provided. There were some missing part in the lecture notes, so you have to attend the lessons on time. Those missing parts were usually questions asked in the two tests.
reviews.comment_grading:
Research Exercise 10%
Individual Assignment 1 10%
Individual Assignment 2 10%
Group Project - Outline 5%
Group Project - Paper 25%
Open-book Test 1 15%
Open-book Test 2 25%

For the Research Exercise, Individual Assignments 1& 2 and Group Outline, they are very easy to get full marks.
For the Group Paper and Open-book Tests, see WORKLOAD.

For reference only:
Research Exercise: 10/10
Individual Assignment 1: 10/10 (Mean:8.34, S.D.:2.33)
Individual Assignment 2: 10/10 (Mean:8.5, S.D.:1.8)
Group Outline: 5/5
Group Paper: 22/25 (Mean:19.5/25, S.D.:3.0)
Test 1: 56/80 (Mean:53.9, S.D.:7.6, Range:13 to 73)
Test 2: 43/60 (Mean: 42.6/60, S.D.:6.5, Range:22 to 57)
Overall grade: A-

Not very good grade but definitely not a bad grade course. As long as you study, you'll receive a rather good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
As I took this course in Winter Semester that lasted for only 4 weeks and had 3 hours each on Monday, Wednesday and Friday, the workload is pretty high. However, if you take this course in other semesters, the workload should be small.

For the Research Exercise, you have to respond to a question in about 200 words after watching a short video. Two videos are provided. You can choose either one. You may have to spend 15 minutes (including watching the video) to do this exercise.

For the Individual Assignment 1, it is about personality. You have to complete an online personality survey first. The survey takes about 10 minutes. Then, according to the your own result, you have to answer 2 guiding questions and write 300 words in total. Including completing the survey, the whole assignment will take you about 40 minutes to complete.

For the Individual Assignment 2, it is about the self. You have to first provide a drawing or a photo of how you slept when you are a baby. After that, you have to analyse your caregiver's intention based on your sleeping location (learnt during lecturers). You have to write about 300 words. This assignment will take you about 30 minutes.

For the group project, you'll form a group of 4 by randomly. The project this time is about COVID-19.
For the group outline, your group have to list 4 unpleasant emotions (can overlap) occurs during COVID-19 and describe how they form. You only need to write in point form. So, the outline will take your 5 minutes to finish. Super easy.
For the Paper, each group member first have to rewrite what written in Outline in sentences (not point form this time) with the support of journal articles. The maximum word count for the first part is 200 words. The second part is a group work that writing a 1600-2000 words essay. This essay is simply about the coping strategies of each of the emotions mentioned in the first part. Each of the group member may have to spend about 2 hours on the whole Group Paper.

The two tests are open-book, open-notes, or even can google.For Test 1, only topics from "Introduction" to "Personality" are tested. For Test 2, only topics from "The Self" to "Psychology Work" are tested. For both tests, you have to study both lecture notes and textbooks. Lecture notes except "Romantic Love" are short in length. However, the topics in textbooks has at least 30 pages. For me the heaviest workload for this course is reading textbook. It is a must to read textbooks as 50% of questions come from lecture notes and another 50% come from textbooks. It is better to start reading textbook as early as you can, and finish reading all before tests.

reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fking heavy I have to say in this semester, more than last semesters, not sure about the coming one. Last semester doesn't require you to design a poster and make a video presentation. One poster, one presentation, two quizzes and one essay this semester, not to mention those little stuff, it's crazy actually. I spent a lot of time in the poster and presentation, I heard many people got low marks for both of them. That means the grading for these two assignments is harsh, so remember to do it seriously if you want to get a good grade.

reviews.author: Cassandraaa.y
reviews.comment_content: The content covered is really interesting as they're actually something in our daily life like relationship, stress, sex etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: The class is quite interesting as they will play a lot of videos of case study and the teacher will give out lots of examples to us as well.
reviews.comment_grading: It's really easy to get high marks, as the two tests account for 60% of the course assessment and they're all MC questions. You don't really have to memorise a lot in my opinion as long as you read the lecture notes and required readings. However, since it's really easy, it's hard to get good grades, I got ~90% of the entire course assessment but I can only get an A-.
reviews.comment_workload: There's no much workload in my opinion, only 2 tests, writing an essay with a partner, and also attend 2 Psychology experiments as I remember, that's it!

reviews.comment_content:
From Formal Course Introduction:

â€œThe course covers various issues that students will encounter during their transition to adulthood.

Students who have taken this course can apply the principles and concepts in meeting the many challenges in everyday life so as to achieve a more adaptive personal growth and better psychological adjustment.

Some topics include understanding of the
self, interpersonal attraction
and love, sexuality, interpersonal communication, stress and
coping, and work-related issues.â€œ
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Lai is not only very beautiful, but also has a delightful voice that intrigues students a lot to what she is teaching. Concentration would not be as significant an issue as other courses.

She is quite interactive and has so much to chat with students after every lecture, unlike some teachers who seem to never know what they are talking.
reviews.comment_grading:

Final Quiz's mean: 29.3/40ã€€(30%)

reviews.author: bich jj
reviews.comment_content:
Covers many psychological topics (e.g. workplace, sex, interpersonal relationship, stress, love, self identity, etc.)
Offers many seemingly trivial behavior an explanation, can be useful and applicable if you have good understanding.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her voice is delightful. Videos shown during lectures. You can learn quite a lot from the course concerning human behavior. Make sure you attend (or have your friend attend) every lesson though, since some key words in lecture slides are missed out. Beatrice likes to pick students to answer question in class and it is fun to watch.
reviews.comment_grading:
Comprised of 2 tests (basically midterm and final, all MC), questions in the tests include content covered in class and those not covered but in the text book. Some questions are tricky but can still score B range if you can manage to get them right. But the tests are still not difficult after all, so if you want to get A range you need to read the text book. Competition is tense.

For the essay, the requirement is not high as it is a 1000 level course. It favors those who can write well. Make sure your topic is something you interested or understood well. Can discuss with TA so don't deadline fighting. Otherwise, hope your groupmate carries you.

Got A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Need to participate in research sessions, which normally runs out of vacancy very soon. You only need to do questionnaire in those sessions.

Need to write an essay about a research topic you choose. The essay is a group project between you and another random teammate assigned by the instructor.

Need to read the text book if you want to get A range.

reviews.comment_content: Easy to understand and very basic concepts so content  is quite simple.

reviews.comment_grading: If you put adequate effort, it is not difficult at all to get a good grade.

reviews.author: Na
reviews.comment_content:
Mid term: Introduction of Psychology, Emotion, Everyday Coping and Personality

Final: Self, Romantic Love, Gender Behavior and Psychology of Work

It is all about psychology with psychological work back up. Tons of psychological studies have been quoted and illustrated to give evidence to human behaviors.

The content is interesting and will force you to ponder over it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Michelle is an awesome Prof that concepts are easy to remember through her explanation. She often shares her experience and link it to the course concepts. Though she sometimes make fun of students causing us to feel embarrassed, the class is full of laugh.  It is never boring to attend her class. Make sure you are on time and don't use your phone during the class so as to avoid being the center of attention as Michelle will point at you :P
reviews.comment_grading:
Research participation (3 psycho labs) : 10%
1 Group paper (2 ppl per group, assigned): 30%
2 Tests : 60%

Got above mean with half sd in mid term and got mean in final. For group paper, I got 1.5 sd below. The grade turned out to be B-.
reviews.comment_workload:
To tackle two tests, you have to read all the chapters in the required textbook as Michelle mentioned 60% of the questions are from the book while the rest are from her note. It is suggested to read the corresponding chapter once when Michelle is teaching that part and read it once again while jotting down notes before the test then you will find it easy to remember the materials. Better not to focus on Michelle's note as there are not much to be tested.

For group paper, it can cost you much time to complete. Only theme is given and you have to figure out a topic and sort of writing an argumentative essay. The reason I said it is time consuming is that you have to find psychological papers to support your argument. If you search it with your own computer, there are not many free-of-charge one so you better do it in Barn or LC? Also, I had poor performance in the paper because my arguments were too sociological not psychological. To avoid this, you should consult the TA regarding to the topic.

Final Grade: B
-------------------------------
I think the grade is relatively good, while my score was around the average, except group project was above half SD. I was expecting to get an B- or C+, so the course grade is relative good for other UST SOSC courses.
reviews.comment_workload:
The course workload was really low. There is only 1 midterm, 1 fianal exam and a group project (2-3 random groupmates).
The midterm and final exam were all MC questions. You can answer most questions if you have attended lessons.
In the group project, you have to write a review (3 pages) of short articles. You can choose your own topic or write the review based on the given suggested topic.

reviews.author: Leojun
reviews.title: Interesting content with passionate professor
reviews.comment_content: I read through the text book only because it was extremely interesting for me. However, lecture content sometimes does not correspond to text book, and this is the reason why you need to attend the lesson
reviews.comment_teaching: Neither cell-phone nor laptop during the class, which I found to be a good way of teaching. Moreover Michelle is a funny person.
reviews.comment_grading: I got one s.d above in the midterm and 0.2 s.d above in the final. And mean for group project, got a B+, which I think it is reasonable, it seems like she strictly follows the grading policy
reviews.comment_workload: You have to work with a randomly assigned project member and I was unlucky meeting a lady with a stubborn, making me extremely hard to work with. And u need to attend the classes, as some of the exam questions are from the videos/experiments during the lecture time. Exam difficulty is just ok, but midterm was a bit strange, btw you really have to read the textbook, sometimes it is not common sense.

reviews.author: xxyyzz
reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.comment_content:
1. Introduction

Content is extremely easy, common sense. I never listened in lessons on zoom. You can read the slides and e-book yourself.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not sure about her teaching cause I never listened lol
reviews.comment_grading:
Research exercise 10%
Assignment 1 10%
Assignment 2 10%
Test 1 15% (80 T/F questions in 1 hour)
Test 2 25% (50 T/F questions + essay max 400 words in 75 mins)
Project outline 5%
Project 25%

No attendance is needed but there will be a few questions in the test related to the content in class (eg the video played, zoom poll result), no zoom recording will be provided too.

My total mark is 80%, ended up with a B.
reviews.comment_workload:
The only thing is that you have to read the e-book detailedly, better to jot notes since you have to read 200+ pages within the one-month course. For test 1, I only read the summaries of the first four chapters in the e-book, that's why I barely finished the paper and got below mean for 9 marks. And for Test 2, I learned from my mistakes and read everything in the e-book even though I wanna throw up. At last, I got a higher mark (above mean for 2 marks) and had enough time to finish it.

The workload is ok for a one-month course, the assignments and research exercises are easy, all are ~300 words essays. For the project, 4 people in a group, you have to write around 400 words per person. The topic is not hard, it's about emotion and coping strategies. The biggest workload of the course imo is the 200+ pages e-book, its horrible for someone who don't like reading English.

reviews.title: Easy
reviews.comment_content: Very easy class. Minimal effort required and you do not need to attend class. The paper does not really make much sense, but you can make stuff up and probably receive a decent grade.

reviews.comment_grading: Grading is quite fair. Midterm average was around a 70 with a standard deviation of 10. I think most people will get an A in the class.

reviews.comment_content: The course content was quite extensive. Psychology of human in various aspects, including love, sex, work, etc. These were quite interesting. The information in the course was also useful in our lives. There were also some interesting facts about different cultures.

reviews.comment_content: the content includes psychology everyday, which includes the topics that are very close to us. It is not hard to go through the content on your own.
